ranked_diseases.explanation: Atypical teratoid/rhabdoid tumor is a hallmark feature of Rhabdoid Tumor Predisposition Syndrome, caused by mutations in the SMARCB1 gene.
Similar to RTPS1, RTPS2 is associated with rhabdoid tumors but is caused by mutations in the SMARCA4 gene.
Li-Fraumeni Syndrome is associated with a wide range of tumors, including atypical teratoid/rhabdoid tumors, due to TP53 mutations.
Although rare, atypical teratoid/rhabdoid tumors have been reported in patients with Neurofibromatosis Type 1, caused by NF1 mutations.
Gorlin Syndrome, caused by PTCH1 mutations, is primarily associated with basal cell carcinomas but has been linked to rare cases of atypical teratoid/rhabdoid tumors.
